gametools

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • gametools.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to animate game objects such as sprites.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int LOOP_CONTINUOUSLY
      Loop the animation non stop infinity times.
      static Animation UNDEFINED_ANIMATION
      An empty animation to represent a non existent or undefined object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation(Animation animation)
      Creates an animation and copies over the properties from the passed in object.
      Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
      Creates an animation with just one still image.
      Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames)
      Creates an animation using each element of the passed in array for a frame.
      Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames, int speed)
      Creates an animation using each element of the passed in array for a frame and sets the animation speed.
      Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames, int speed, int repeatAmount)
      Creates an animation using each element of the passed in array for a frame and sets the animation speed and repeat amount.

        Loop the animation non stop infinity times.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UNDEFINED_ANIMATION

        public static final Animation UNDEFINED_ANIMATION
        An empty animation to represent a non existent or undefined object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Creates an animation with just one still image.
        Parameters:
        image - A buffered image for the animation.

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames)
        Creates an animation using each element of the passed in array for a frame.
        Parameters:
        frames - An array of images that represent each frame of the animation.

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames,
                 int speed)
        Creates an animation using each element of the passed in array for a frame and sets the animation speed.
        Parameters:
        frames - An array of images that represent each frame of the animation.
        speed - The how many updates it should take for the animation. to move to the next frame.

      • Animation

        public Animation(Animation animation)
        Creates an animation and copies over the properties from the passed in object.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation to copy the properties from.

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames,
                 int speed,
                 int repeatAmount)
        Creates an animation using each element of the passed in array for a frame and sets the animation speed and repeat amount.
        Parameters:
        frames - An array of images that represent each frame of the animation.
        speed - The how many updates it should take for the animation.
        repeatAmount - The amount of times the animation should repeat before completing.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the animation. This is automatically set to be the width of the animation frames.
        Returns:
        The width of the sprite.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the animation. This is automatically set to be the height of the animation frames.
        Returns:
        The height of the sprite.

      • getDimensions

        public java.awt.Dimension getDimensions()
        Returns:
        A dimension representing that contains both the width and height of the animation.

      • getFrame

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getFrame()
        Returns:
        A buffered image of the current frame of the animation.

      • getAllFrames

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] getAllFrames()
        Returns:
        A array of the buffered images for each frame.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns:
        The amount of frames in the animation.

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        Returns:
        The amount of updates it will take to move to the next frame of the animation.

      • getFrameNumber

        public int getFrameNumber()
        Returns:
        The current frame the animation is at.

      • getRepeatNumber

        public int getRepeatNumber()
        Returns:
        The amount of times the animation has already replayed.

      • getRepeatAmount

        public int getRepeatAmount()
        Returns:
        The amount of times the animation will repeat before stopping.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Returns:
        True is the animation has completed.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns:
        True if the animation is currently paused.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(int speed)
        Sets how many frames it will take for the animation to move to the next image.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed of the animation.

      • setFrameNumber

        public void setFrameNumber(int frameNumber)
        Parameters:
        frameNumber - The frame the animation should jump to.

      • setRepeatAmount

        public void setRepeatAmount(int repeatAmount)
        Parameters:
        repeatAmount - Sets the amount of times the animation should repeat.

      • pause

        public void pause(boolean pause)
        Pauses or resumes the animation.
        Parameters:
        pause - Whether to pause or resume to animation.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets and restarts the animations.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the animation and moves it to the next frame if necessary.
